p:
With regard to the types of seed dispersal, the native and exotic species in the vegetation and the seed bank at the roadsides presented no difference in type of dispersal ( X
2 = 0.19, Df = 1, P = 0.6). Exotic and native anemochorous species accounted for 24% and 29% of the species richness, respectively. Exotic and native non-anemochorous species (autochorous and zoochorous) represented 18% and 29% of the species richness, respectively ( Table 1).
